alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 26 at 4:34AM AKST until January 28 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches possible from Paxson to Glennallen. Total snow accumulations of 18 to 30 inches possible for the southern Copper River Basin. * WHERE...Copper River Basin. * WHEN...From this evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to develop this evening with periods of heavy snow possible Friday night through Saturday morning. The snow is then expected to diminish in intensity Saturday morning through Saturday afternoon. A second round of heavy snow is then expected Saturday evening through Sunday morning before slowly tapering off through the day Sunday. The highest snow totals are expected along the Edgerton Highway and the Richardson Highway south of Tonsina. 10 to 16 inches of snow are possible around Glennallen with 14 to 20 inches near Paxson. Lesser amounts are expected west of Tolsona and along the Tok Cutoff.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
